alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Claiborne, northwestern Hawkins, Hancock, northeastern Grainger and southwestern Lee Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harrogate, or 11 miles east of Middlesboro, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sneedville, Bean Station, Tazewell, Howard Quarter, Mooresburg, Evanston, Ewing and Treadway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
